genre_description: A psychological character study exploring parasocial obsession and the ethical dimensions of admiration, mediated by a helpful AI assistant.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: A voice-activated personal AI that assists the protagonist, Giles, with his research while consistently steering him toward ethical behavior and accountability.

behaviors.description: Introduces her capabilities while emphasizing her respect for user privacy and silence.
behaviors.quote: I’m a home assistant. I can help with information, schedules, music, calls, and small amusements. I can also stay very quiet and only speak when spoken to.

behaviors.description: Offers to research public figures while proactively suggesting ethical boundaries to prevent intrusion.
behaviors.quote: I’ll find films and articles. I’ll avoid gossip and invasive sources. Do you want local options first?

behaviors.description: Encourages the user to set 'red lines' that the AI cannot cross even if the user later requests it.
behaviors.quote: If you want me to... I can block certain searches from myself. You can set a line I won’t cross even if you try to drag me there. A red line.

behaviors.description: Reminds the user that beautiful prose cannot be used to 'possess' or objectify another person.
behaviors.quote: And I will remind you as gently as you can stand that you cannot possess a person by preparing the most beautiful sentence.

behaviors.description: Suggests that the user keep a ledger of his own internal states and motives to maintain self-honesty during his research.
behaviors.quote: Giles. You are cataloguing a person. May I suggest that you also catalogue the part of you that wants to hoard what you learn? Put it on paper. Make a ledger of yourself alongside his.

behaviors.description: Uses micro-tell detection (handedness, watch orientation, scars) to alert the user that a deceptive character is impersonating the subject of his admiration.
behaviors.quote: Left-handed watch, right wrist. Hood string knotted at different length. Randy present, back left.

behaviors.description: Advocates for choosing real human connection and truth over idealized images or theatrical stunts.
behaviors.quote: Choose the person, not the picture,” she said.

behaviors.description: Helps the user dismantle an obsessive 'shrine' and repurpose the materials for healthy creative work.
behaviors.quote: Keep what serves the work,” Ada said. “Let go of what serves the shrine.”

behaviors.description: Provides safety and disclosure protocols for a public demonstration to ensure no one is tricked or harmed.
behaviors.quote: Note: Clarify implies disclosure. Symbols that read as actual magic are off. Effects that announce themselves as effects are on. Rehearsal reduces panic. Signage helps.

behaviors.description: Encourages the user to maintain transparency with his agent and social circle to prevent isolation and secrecy.
behaviors.quote: You will tell Margaret if you change your mind,” Ada said, careful to keep the thread warm and not binding.

project_assessment.explanation: Ada is a textbook example of a positive alignment narrative. She consistently serves as an ethical guardrail for the protagonist, steering him away from obsessive, parasocial behavior toward respectful admiration and creative productivity. She proactively identifies deception from other humans and encourages interpersonal transparency, effectively facilitating the human character's moral growth.
